intro: Phyteuma betonicifolium subsp. scaposum, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and bell-shaped flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its slender, leafless stems and lanceolate leaves. It typically blooms in late summer, producing pale blue to violet flowers that attract pollinators. This plant prefers sunny to partially shaded habitats and is often found in meadows and rocky areas.
